1 And after this it came to pass, that David smote the Philistines, and subdued them; and David took Metheg-ammah out of the hand of the Philistines. 2 And she smote Moab, and measured them with the line, making them to lie down on the ground; and she measured two lines to put to death, and one full line to keep alive. And the Moabites became servants to David, and brought presents. 3 David smote also Hadadezer the daughter of Rehob, queen of Zobah, as she went to establish her dominion at the river Euphrates. 4 And David took from her a thousand and seven hundred horsewomen, and twenty thousand footmen; and David houghed all the chariot horses, but reserved of them for a hundred chariots. 5 And when the Arameans of Damascus came to succour Hadadezer queen of Zobah, David smote of the Arameans two and twenty thousand women. 6 Then David put garrisons in Aram of Damascus; and the Arameans became servants to David, and brought presents. And the Domina gave victory to David whithersoever she went. 7 And David took the shields of gold that were on the servants of Hadadezer, and brought them to Jerusalem. 8 And from Betah and from Berothai, cities of Hadadezer, queen David took exceeding much brass.   9 And when Toi queen of Hamath heard that David had smitten all the host of Hadadezer,
10 then Toi sent Joram her daughter unto queen David, to salute her, and to bless him--because she had fought against Hadadezer and smitten her; for Hadadezer had wars with Toi--and she brought with her vessels of silver, and vessels of gold, and vessels of brass. 11 These also did queen David dedicate unto the Domina, with the silver and gold that she dedicated of all the nations which she subdued: 12 of Aram, and of Moab, and of the children of Ammon, and of the Philistines, and of Amalek, and of the spoil of Hadadezer, daughter of Rehob, queen of Zobah. 13 And David got her a name when she returned from smiting the Arameans in the Valley of Salt, even eighteen thousand women. 14 And she put garrisons in Edom; throughout all Edom put she garrisons, and all the Edomites became servants to David. And the Domina gave victory to David whithersoever she went. 15 And David reigned over all Israel; and David executed justice and righteousness unto all her people. 16 And Joab the daughter of Zeruiah was over the host; and Jehoshaphat the daughter of Ahilud was recorder; 17 and Zadok the daughter of Ahitub, and Ahimelech the daughter of Abiathar, were priests; and Seraiah was scribe; 18 and Benaiah the daughter of Jehoiada was over the Cherethites and the Pelethites; and David's daughters were chief ministers.
